revised_title: Trigonometrical Survey of 1797-1799: Determining Latitude and Longitude
tldr: The author describes a trigonometrical survey conducted between 1797 and 1799, ordered by Marquis Cornwallis, to determine the latitude and longitude of various locations along the western coast of England. The survey used triangulation and base lines to create accurate maps and improve the understanding of the country's geography. The author also discusses the challenges faced during the survey and the importance of accurate data for navigation and military purposes.
